tool_description:
Foodprint API gives you the carbon footprint of food products.
It can help you with you next food apps, in order to give extra information about the products.
name: Foodprint
title: Foodprint

api_list.name: getCategories
api_list.description: Gives all the existing categories in order to help you make the right calls.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/getCategories"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/getCategories"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

No parameter expected.

api_list.name: firstBestProductByGroup
api_list.description:
Gives the "x" best products (with the lowest footprint) of a given group.
For example, you can write drinks and 10 to get the first 10 drinks with the best footprint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/firstBestProductByGroup/drinks/10"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/firstBestProductByGroup/{group}/{qty}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getBestProductByGroup
api_list.description:
For valid response try to write the name of the group you want to get the ranking from.
You can write, for example, drinks to get the ranking of the drinks group (from best to worst footprint).
If the string you entered doesn't appear in any product name, it will generate an error.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/bestProductByGroup/drinks"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/bestProductByGroup/{group}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductByFootprint
api_list.description:
For valid response try to enter a float value.
The footprint value is a float number which gives you the kg of CO2 eq/kg of product.
That means if the footprint is 0.8, then it rejects 0.8 kg of CO2 per kilogram of product.
You can write, for example, 0.8 to get all the products with a better footprint than 0.8.
If there isn't any product with a better footprint than the value you entered, it will generate an error.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/footprint/0.8"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/footprint/{footprint}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductByRatingQuality
api_list.description:
For valid response try to enter a parameter between 1 (excluded) and 5 (excluded) .
The quality rating is a float between 1 (great confidence in the rating) and 5 (lots of unknowns that could, possibly, make the rating inaccurate).
You can write, for example, 1.5 to get all the products with a better quality rating than 1.5 (= rating < 1.5).
If the number you entered isn't between 1 and 5, it will generate an error.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/rating_quality/1.5"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/rating_quality/{rating_quality}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductsByCategory
api_list.description:
For valid response try to write the name of the category you want to get products from.
You can write, for example, waters to get all the waters which are inside the drinks group and the waters category.
If the string you entered doesn't appear in any product name, it will generate an error.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/category/waters"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductsByGroup
api_list.description:
Get all the products of a given group. you can write.
For example,  enter drinks to get all the available information about drinks. 
You don't need to enter the exact group name, drink will show you all the products in the drinks group.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/group/drinks"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductByFrenchName
api_list.description:
For valid response try to write the french name of the product you want to get.
You can write, for example, lait to get lait, lait d'amande, lait pour nourrissons, etc.
If the string you entered doesn't appear in any product name, it will generate an error.
Be careful and add the special letters like bière and not biere.

api_list.name: getProductByName
api_list.description:
For valid response try to write the name of the product you want to get.
You can write, for example, milk to get milk, almond milk, baby milk, etc. 
If the string you entered doesn't appear in any product name, it will generate an error.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://foodprint.p.rapidapi.com/api/foodprint/name/sausage"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "foodprint.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
